Interface BoardView

All Known Implementing Classes:
BoardFacade
public interface BoardView
Read-only interface exposing the state of a Sudoku board.

A BoardView provides methods to query cell values and properties (for example, whether a cell is given) without allowing direct modification. This enforces separation between the model (the Board) and presentation layers (BoardPanel, CellView).

  • Method Details

    • get

      int get(int r, int c)
      Returns the digit stored in the specified cell.
      Parameters:
      r - the row index
      c - the column index
      Returns:
      the cell's digit in [0..SIZE], where 0 means empty

    • isGiven

      boolean isGiven(int r, int c)
      Indicates whether the specified cell is a fixed "given" (i.e., part of the initial puzzle and not user-editable).
      Parameters:
      r - the row index
      c - the column index
      Returns:
      true if this cell is a given; false otherwise

    • trySet

      boolean trySet(int r, int c, int val)
      Attempts to set a digit value in the given cell.

      Implementations validate whether the target cell is editable and, if so, update the underlying model. Returning false indicates that the operation was rejected (for example, because the cell was marked as a given or failed internal validation).

      Parameters:
      r - the row index
      c - the column index
      val - the digit to place, or 0 to clear the cell
      Returns:
      true if the value was successfully applied; false otherwise

    • isSolved

      boolean isSolved()
      Returns true if all cells of the board are filled with nonzero digits satisfying the puzzle's solved condition.
      Returns:
      whether the board is fully solved

    • tryClear

      boolean tryClear(int r, int c)
      Attempts to clear a cell at the given coordinates.

      The operation fails if the cell is a given (immutable) clue.

      Parameters:
      r - row index
      c - column index
      Returns:
      true if the cell was cleared; false if it was a given

    • hasUniqueSolution

      boolean hasUniqueSolution()
      Returns the solved digit for the given cell from the Solver.

      This assumes the solver has already been run on a compatible board and that the solved state is still cached.

      Parameters:
      r - row index
      c - column index
      Returns:
      the solved digit for (r, c)

    • solutionAt

      int solutionAt(int r, int c)
      Returns the solved digit for the given cell from the Solver.

      This assumes the solver has already been run on a compatible board and that the solved state is still cached.

      Parameters:
      r - row index
      c - column index
      Returns:
      the solved digit for (r, c)

    • setUnsafe

      void setUnsafe(int r, int c, int val)
      Sets a digit in the given cell without any legality checks.

      This method respects givens (it will not overwrite them) but does not verify row/column/box constraints. Intended for UI features such as hinting or showing incorrect entries.

      Parameters:
      r - row index
      c - column index
      val - digit to store
